page.title: 07Ecology in Handsacre.
page.content: THE WILD AREA. At the top of Hayes Meadow School field there is a wild area.In this area there are: Trees:Beech,Wild Cherry,Guelder Rose,Larch,Oak,Rowan,Silver Birch,Sweet Chestnut,Hawthorn,Wayfaring,Scots Pine and Field Maple. Insects: (Including)Ants,Spiders,Flies, Wood-Louse and Ladybirds. SAND AND GRAVEL PIT (Kings Bromely) At the quarry there is an important reserve.Birds include:Mallards,Coots, Teal,Moorhens,Canadian-Geese and the bigest inland colony of Cormorants in Britain.The River Trent flows into the quarry water. NEW PLANTATION WOOD (Etchills Farm). In the wood owned by Mr.Prince.There are:Cuckoos,Sparrow-hawks,pheasents and Tree-creepers.Also there are alot of rabbits and squirrels.
